TextSection.Contents: Distal trisomy 19q is a rare chromosomal anomaly syndrome characterized by low birth weight developmental delay intellectual disability short stature craniofacial dysmorphism (incl. microcephaly midface hypoplasia hypertelorism flat nasal bridge ear anomalies short philtrum downturned corners of the mouth micrognathia) and a short neck with redundant skin folds. Additional features may include hypotonia skeletal anomalies (e.g. clino/camptodactyly) seizures and congenital cardiac urogenital and gastrointestinal malformations.

Parent.Label: Partial duplication of the long arm of chromosome 19
